subject: Well, Damn
event: Sometimes I hate Live Journal. I've been working all day on a new post, a long long long look back on the year that is ending, and all the things that happened in it, the good and the bad. I know, I know. I should have broken it up. Made it three posts, or four. But I didn't, and somehow I lost it. No problem, I figured. LJ has a "restore previous draft" function. Sadly, however, when I use it, I get a short two paragraph post that I started last night and then abandoned, after deciding I didn't want to post about that after all. Today's post, the long long long long one (and it wasn't finished), seems to have vanished into the ether, and I can't get it back. Nor do I have the energy (or time) to recreate it. Hell of a way to end the year. Sorry.

comments.article: Shit
comments.subject: Well

comments.article:
Yeah, that's why I try to save what I'm writing directly on the internet in different forms, something like that *always* happens...
Anyway, I hope you won't lose the post for 2017! I hope it will be longer! Happy New Year, sir!
Sometimes the possibility of a thing makes the reader imagine even more... so, in my mind, it was the greatest end-of-year post ever.
comments.subject: Happy New Year

comments.article: Have you ever lost any chapter from Winds? Screen it lol
comments.subject: Lost chapters

comments.article: Never.  And you know why?  Because I write my fiction with WordStar 4.0 on a DOS machine.  Stable as a rock, with none of the glitches of Windows-based systems.
comments.subject: Re: Lost chapters

comments.article: Nothing to apologise for! Happy new year from Norway!

Don't you just love tech? 😱
Hope you have a wonderful new year all the same! =^.^= (and less tech glitches in 2016...)

I seem to recall Jack saying something about his transition to writing on a computer.

His wife, Blanche, walked past his desk carrying aluminum Christmas garland and somehow the static buildup and her proximity wiped an entire story he was working on.
comments.subject: Jack Williamson

comments.article: You can still give us the "tl;dr" part of it.
comments.subject: Damn

comments.article:
If it makes you feel any better, most people on the internet seem to be seeing the funny side of it!

I've gotta say it, this is why people use word processors!

So frustrating. My faith in LJ is low enough that I developed the habit of writing longer posts in a word processing program and copying it over for this very reason.

Happy New Year, may 2016 be glitch-free.
I do the same thing. LJ hates me.

This has to be a joke post right? George you know your fandom was waiting all day for this post, hoping for news on you know what and all you manage is "Sorry". Come on, youd think we would deserve better than that.
No joke.  Sorry.
The tale grew in the telling. Both teams played hard.
Sorry to hear, as i always enjoy your posts. Even the ones about the stinkin' Jets. Hoping for an incredibly awesome New Year for you. ❤
comments.subject: That always sucks

comments.article: As long as nothing like that happens with Winds, we forgive you. ;)
comments.subject: Very annoying

comments.article: Oh, my goodness, do I feel your pain. I've done that on more than one occasion, usually when trying to explain some complicated rules issue in WSFS. Sympathy.
George, thanks for taking the time even if we didn't get to see it. Cheers to you, and I hope 2016 is amazing and inspiring for you! :)
So it goes...

Tomorrow is a new year, with a fresh start. I hope next year is rewarding for you in every way.

Go have a glass of wine and relax tonight, human error happens!
comments.subject: Things happen, don't worry!

comments.article: Upvote! George is constantly writing, if he is tired and needs tonight off, sobeit. Personally, Ive been waiting for a real Winds update since 2012(whenever Dance came out) and I dont want GRRM stressedwhen he needs to be with family celebrating yhe New Year.
comments.subject: RE: Things happen, don't worry!

comments.article: I recommend using Google Documents. Your drafts will always be automatically saved online.
Have a wonderful New Year anyhow!!
comments.subject: Sorry!

comments.article: Wanted to wish you a very happy new year .  Ill be coloring tonight from my christmas present to myself .  Thank you for ASOIAF , A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms and the world of  ice and Fire .  I have found great pleasure in annoying my relatives who only watch the show it made christmas fun :)
comments.subject: Happy New Year

comments.article: Well, Damn.
comments.subject: Well, Damn

comments.article:
Hello Mr. Martin,

That must feel incredibly frustrating to go through that. Live Journal has a lot of improvements to be made, and updated saves on typed posts would go a long way toward preventing this type of event. Have you considered cloud systems like Google Drive that save your work as you go?

As a dear, long-term fan of you and your works, I was wondering if there was any way you could post a short, concise review of what you had to say, even if it doesn't necessarily come today. I'm sure we all would appreciate anything, even if it isn't the long and complete update you were planning on posting. Have a great New Year's Eve!
Well, the system does have regular saves, and usually "Restore" will bring them back.  But today, for whatever reason, it does not bring back today's post but the one I aborted last night.
comments.subject: Re: :(

comments.article: I've had this happen so many times on the blog as well. For very long posts I normally Copy+Paste into Word or Notepad at periodic intervals.
I'd write in Notepad (or Wordstar) and then paste into LJ

Real sorry. A lot of people were really looking forward to that post. Do you still plan on saying a little thing about the book or should we wait till next year?

So Spake Martin about the Giants: Life is pain and filled with suffering.

EDIT: Also, I'm sorry I forgot -- Happy New Year! :D
